Park City Events & Festivals

World-Class Events and Cultural Celebrations Year-Round

Signature Annual Events

Park City hosts world-renowned events year-round, from the prestigious Sundance Film Festival to action-packed sporting competitions.

Sundance Film Festival

When: January | The world's premier independent film festival transforms Park City into Hollywood's winter playground.

  • 120+ feature films and documentaries
  • Celebrity sightings and red carpet events
  • Public screenings available to all
  • Book accommodations 6+ months early
  • Shuttle services and park-and-ride available

Park City Food & Wine Classic

When: July | A culinary celebration featuring world-class chefs, winemakers, and spirits producers.

  • Grand tasting events with 100+ vendors
  • Celebrity chef cooking demonstrations
  • Educational wine and spirits seminars
  • Exclusive multi-course dinners
  • VIP experiences and tastings

Deer Valley Music Festival

When: July-August | Utah Symphony performs under the stars at Snow Park Amphitheater with stunning mountain views.

  • Utah Symphony orchestral performances
  • Guest artists and special collaborations
  • Picnics encouraged on the lawn
  • Rain or shine performances
  • Reserved and lawn seating options

Park City Kimball Arts Festival

When: August | One of the top arts festivals in the country featuring 200+ artists on historic Main Street.

  • 200+ juried artists from across the nation
  • Live music and entertainment stages
  • Food vendors and culinary experiences
  • Free admission for all attendees
  • Kids' activities and art workshops

Autumn Aloft Hot Air Balloon Festival

When: September | Colorful hot air balloons fill the sky during this spectacular family-friendly festival.

  • Dawn balloon launches from multiple sites
  • Evening balloon glow events
  • Tethered balloon rides for families
  • Food trucks and craft vendors
  • Live music and entertainment

FIS Freestyle World Cup

When: January-February | Watch the world's best aerial and mogul skiers compete at Deer Valley Resort.

  • Olympic and World Cup athletes
  • Free spectator viewing areas
  • Moguls and aerial competitions
  • Family activities and entertainment
  • Food and beverage vendors on-site

Seasonal Events Calendar

Winter Events (December-March)

  • December: Christmas Eve Torchlight Parade
  • January: Sundance Film Festival, FIS World Cup
  • February: Skier's Ball, Valentine's dinners
  • March: Spring concerts, pond skimming
  • Weekly: Saturday night fireworks at PCMR
  • Special: Full moon snowshoe tours

Spring Events (April-May)

  • April: Spring Carnival, Easter events
  • May: Park City Marathon, Memorial Day
  • Cycling: Road and mountain bike races
  • Golf: Tournament season begins
  • Markets: Farmers markets resume
  • Art: Gallery walks and openings

Summer Events (June-August)

  • June: Savor the Summit, Olympic Park events
  • July: 4th of July Parade, Food & Wine Classic
  • August: Kimball Arts Festival, Miners' Day
  • Weekly: Park Silly Sunday Market
  • Thursdays: Live music at Canyons Village
  • Saturdays: Park City Farmers Market

Fall Events (September-November)

  • September: Autumn Aloft, Wine Festival
  • October: Oktoberfest, Halloween events
  • November: Thanksgiving events, film series
  • Special: Fall foliage tours and hikes
  • Harvest: Farm dinners and tours
  • Shopping: Holiday markets begin

Music & Performance Venues

Concert Venues

  • Deer Valley Snow Park Amphitheater: 5,000-seat outdoor venue
  • DeJoria Center: 300-seat indoor venue at Olympic Park
  • Egyptian Theatre: Historic Main Street venue
  • Eccles Center: State-of-the-art performing arts center
  • Canyons Village: Free summer concert series

Regular Performance Series

  • St. Mary's Concert Series: Free Wednesday evening concerts
  • Mountain Town Music: Year-round classical performances
  • Park City Institute: Lectures and performances
  • Egyptian Theatre Company: Local theater productions
  • Jazz @ DeJoria: Monthly jazz performances

Intimate Venues

  • High West Distillery: Weekend acoustic sets
  • The Spur: Live bands and dancing
  • No Name Saloon: Local and touring acts
  • Riverhorse on Main: Jazz and piano nights
  • Kimball Art Center: Acoustic showcases

Sports & Competition Events

Winter Sports

  • FIS Freestyle World Cup competitions
  • Dew Tour extreme sports event
  • USASA snowboard and ski competitions
  • Nordic Combined jumping events
  • Youth ski racing programs
  • Adaptive sports competitions

Summer Sports

  • Tour of Utah professional cycling
  • Triple Crown running series
  • Mountain bike races and festivals
  • Golf tournaments at local courses
  • Trail running competitions
  • Triathlon and endurance events

Olympic Legacy Events

  • Flying Ace All-Stars aerial shows
  • Nordic ski jumping demonstrations
  • Bobsled and skeleton experiences
  • Olympic athlete training camps
  • Youth development programs
  • Adaptive sports showcases

Holiday Celebrations

Winter Holidays

  • Thanksgiving: Turkey Trot, special restaurant menus
  • Christmas: Santa visits, tree lightings, carolers
  • Hanukkah: Menorah lighting ceremonies
  • New Year's: Fireworks, torchlight parades
  • Winter Solstice: Lantern walks and celebrations

Summer Holidays

  • Memorial Day: Parades and remembrance ceremonies
  • 4th of July: Biggest celebration of the year
  • Pioneer Day (July 24): Utah state holiday
  • Labor Day: End of summer festivals
  • Indigenous Peoples Day: Cultural celebrations

Special Celebrations

  • Mardi Gras: Fat Tuesday celebrations on Main Street
  • St. Patrick's Day: Irish music and festivities
  • Cinco de Mayo: Mexican culture and food
  • Halloween: Trick-or-treating on Main Street
  • Día de los Muertos: Day of the Dead celebrations

Event Planning & Tickets

Booking & Tickets

  • Book accommodations early for major events
  • Many summer concerts sell out in advance
  • Check for package deals with hotels
  • Some events offer local resident discounts
  • Free events still require planning for parking
  • Consider season passes for multiple events

Getting Around During Events

  • Use free public transit when possible
  • Ride-sharing surge pricing during big events
  • Park and ride lots available for major festivals
  • Main Street closes for some festivals
  • Book dinner reservations well in advance
  • Walk or bike for short distances
